availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Harrison Whitecotton (Union County, Kentucky, laborer and soldier.)

body.p: Union County, Kentucky, laborer and soldier. Union County, Kentucky, native. Son of George W. Whitecotton and Nancy Whitecotton. Married to Victoria Ara Nunn Whitecotton in Crittenden County, Kentucky, on September 25, 1860. Father of George O. Whitecotton. Resident of Union County, Kentucky, in 1850. Laborer in Union County in 1860. Served in the 10th Kentucky Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private from August 20, 1862, to June 23, 1864. Captured at Salineville, Columbiana County, Ohio, on July 26, 1863. Prisoner of war at Camp Douglas, Illinois from August 22, 1863 to June 23, 1864. Escaped from Camp Douglas on June 23, 1864.

ab.bibl:
